results.title: Carve her name with pride
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Daniel M. Angel and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on R.J. Minney’s novel this inspiring true story of war heroine, Violette Szabo, who volunteered to be parachuted into France as a secret agent to re-organise a shattered resistance group. Virginia McKenna gives the performance of her career as the courageous secret agent, and this magnificent film ensures that no-one will forget Violette’s bravery and conviction in what she believed in most - freedom from tyranny. Also stars Paul Scofield, Jack Warner, Denise Grey and Maurice Ronet.

results.title: The Endless summer
results.creator_credit: Bruce Brown and Bruce Brown Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Golden years of surf collection”.
The archetypal surfing film of the 1960’s, Bruce Brown defied all odds to produce one of the most successful feature-length documentary films in movie history. Filmed on locations world-wide, with diverting tongue-in- cheek narrative by Brown, we follow two surfers’ quest for the ultimate wave. The heady surfing days of the sixties are forever captured in this classic.

results.title: The Girl can't help it
results.creator_credit: Frank Tashlin and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This wonderfully farcical comedy is the first big budget rock and roll movie of the fifties and features seventeen great songs of the era. Tom Ewell plays a down and out agent who is hired by a mobster to make a star out of his sex-pot girlfriend (Jayne Mansfield). Ewell gives her a rock and roll act in the hope of making the big time but Jayne yearns for the simple life and complications set in when she falls for Ewell, while searching for the perfect husband. Includes Little Richard, Eddie Cochran, Gene Vincent, Platters, Fats Domino and more. Also stars Edmond O’Brien.

results.title: Finian's rainbow
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Joseph Landon, Seven Artists and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: He wears a battered felt hat and a tattered old cardigan instead of a top hat and tails but one glimpse of those agile feet and you know he’s Fred Astaire. This exuberant, delightful film is well up to the honour of being his last musical. Based on the 1947 Broadway hit, Fred Astaire plays an Irish rogue with a whimsical economic theory: bury a stolen crock of leprechaun gold in the soil near Fort Knox and stand back! Mixed up in the shenanigans are his spirited daughter (Petula Clark) and love-struck leprechaun (Tommy Steele). Director Francis Ford Coppola skilfully updates the Broadway hit and lovingly show cases its most enduring treasure - the Burton Lane/E.Y. Harburg score. This charming film garnered an Oscar nomination for Musical Direction and includes well-known numbers such as ‘If this isn’t love’, ‘How are things in Glocca Morra?’, ‘Look to the rainbow’ and ‘Old devil moon’.

results.title: Our town
results.creator_credit: Sam Woods, Sol Lesser and Principal Artists
results.brief_description: Thorton Wilder’s Pulitzer Prize-winning play was adapted to the screen, bringing to life an array of wonderful characters played by an impressive cast. Set in Grover’s Corner, New Hampshire, the typical American small-town of the early 1900’s is vividly recreated. Frank Craven as the narrator takes us on a “peephole” tour where we are given a simple yet dramatic account of what goes on in the lives of people from childhood to courtship; from birth to death. A young William Holden and Martha Scott in her first screen appearance, are the focal characters. Sam Wood’s techniques: a series of dazzling dissolves, evocative lighting and effective montages capture the essence of the period, so much so, that “Our Town” has become a cinema classic to be treasured in the hearts of film lovers.

results.title: The Little convict
results.creator_credit: Sandra Gross, Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In old New South Wales a new batch of convicts arrives including the little convict, young Toby Nelson. Consigned to a Government farm they are subjected to the cruelty of their tyrannical overseers, Sergeant Billy Langden and Corporal Weazel Wesley, finally resulting in the death of the pickpocket, Old Dipper. Toby escapes and flees into the alien Australian bush where he is saved from death by the aboriginal boy Wahroonga. Together with another escapee, highwayman Jack Doolan, and Wahroonga’s animal friends, they launch a spectacular mission to rescue the blacksmith Big George and Toby’s sister Polly. With Rolf Harris as a storyteller and the magic of live action and animation, this wonderful Australian historical adventure comes joyously to life.

results.title: Mister Roberts
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, John Ford, Leland Hayward and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hailed by critics as a classic of the American cinema, “Mister Roberts” is an adaptation of the smash hit Broadway play about life on a small naval cargo ship floating ‘somewhere between the Islands of Tedium and Ennui’ in the Pacific Ocean during World War II. Fonda is outstanding as the gentle cargo officer who protects his men from the shop’s tyrannical captain, played by James Cagney. Also in the cast is Jack Lemmon in his Academy Award winning role as Ensign Pulver and William Powell as Doc Daneeka.

results.title: Strictly ballroom
results.creator_credit: Catherine Martin, Jill Bilcock, Baz Luhrmann, Tristram Miall and M and A Productions
results.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the “establishment” by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps and taking on a new ugly-duckling partner who blooms under his tutelage. Ballet dancer Paul Mercurio shot to fame with this film. He is partnered by Tara Morice and supported by Barry Otto, Gia Carides and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Round midnight
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Irwin Winkler and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted drama, a moving tribute to the great jazz musicians who lived and performed in Paris in the late 1950’s. Dedicated to the jazz giants, Bud Powell and Lester Young, the film features real-life jazz veteran, the gravel-voiced Dexter Gordon. It dramatises the friendship between an aging jazz saxophonist (Gordon) and a passionate young French admirer who is ready to make personal sacrifices to help his idol. Set to Herbie Hancock’s superb Academy Award-winning score, “Round Midnight” is an elegant, evocative ode to the free-spirited but technically demanding jazz music which blossomed in post-war Paris.

results.title: Murder she said
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “4.50 from Paddington” by Agatha Christie also published as “What Mrs McGillicuddy Saw!” Dozing in her seat as the train leaves Paddington Station, Miss Jane Marple awakens to witness a strangulation aboard a passing train. The police do not believe her but undaunted, Miss Marple takes a job as a domestic in an attempt to discover the truth. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Arthur Kennedy, Muriel Pavlow and James Robertson Justice.
